Please confirm that you want to mark all selected items as played.
Please confirm that you want to mark all selected items as unplayed.
Please confirm that you want to delete the podcast \"%1$s\", ALL its episodes (including downloaded episodes), playback history, and its statistics.
Please confirm that you want to remove the selected podcasts, ALL their episodes (including downloaded episodes), playback history, and its statistics.

Multi select actions shown at the bottom
Last refresh failed. Tap to view details.
Please wait until the data is loaded
Please confirm that you want to delete the tag \"%1$s\".
Refreshing podcasts over mobile data connection is disabled in the settings.\n\nDo you want to refresh anyway?

Your VPN app pretends to be a mobile network (metered connection). Refreshing podcasts over mobile data connection is disabled in the settings.\n\nDo you want to refresh anyway? If you want this problem to be fixed, contact the creators of your VPN app.
Please confirm that you want to delete all played downloads.
To jump to positions, you need to play the episode
Deleting removes the episode from AntennaPod and deletes the media file from your device storage. It cannot be downloaded again through AntennaPod.
Download of \"%1$s\" failed. Will be retried later.
There is not enough space left on your device.
The podcast host\'s server sent a broken podcast feed. We recommend checking with a podcast validator such as castfeedvalidator.com and contacting the podcast creator to let them know.
The podcast host\'s server sent a website, not a podcast.
The podcast host\'s server does not know where to find the file. It may have been deleted.
Cannot find the server. Check if the address is typed correctly and if you have a working network connection.
Authentication error. Make sure that username and password are correct.
The podcast host\'s server refuses to respond.
The server connection was lost before completing the download
The download was blocked by another app on your device (like a VPN or ad blocker).
Unable to establish a secure connection. This can mean that another app on your device (like a VPN or an ad blocker) blocked the download, or that something is wrong with the server certificates.
The link you tapped does not contain a valid podcast URL. Please verify the link and try again, or search for the podcast manually.
The suggested podcast did not have an RSS link, AntennaPod found a podcast that could match
Downloading over mobile data connection is disabled in the settings. AntennaPod can download the episode later automatically when Wi-Fi is available.

Your VPN app pretends to be a mobile network (metered connection). Downloading over mobile data connection is disabled in the settings. If you want this problem to be fixed, contact the creators of your VPN app.

plurals.name: mobile_download_notice
plurals.item: Downloading over mobile data connection for the next %d minute
Downloading over mobile data connection for the next %d minutes

resources.string: Streaming over mobile data connection is disabled in the settings. Tap to stream anyway.

The media file could not be played.

- Try deleting and re-downloading the episode.
- Check your network connection, and make sure no VPN or login page is blocking access.
- Try long-pressing and sharing the "Media address" to your web browser to see if it can be played there. If not, contact the podcast creators.
Item does not contain a media file
If you lock the queue, you can no longer swipe or reorder episodes.
Please confirm that you want to remove ALL episodes from the queue.
%1$.2fx is already saved as a preset.

After you listen to an episode, it will appear here.
When you add a podcast, the episodes will be shown here.
Try clearing the filter to see more episodes.
When new episodes arrive, they will be shown here. You can then decide if you are interested in them or not.
To subscribe to a podcast, press the plus icon below.

An error has occurred while reading the file. Make sure that you have actually selected an OPML file and that the file is valid.
Create a backup of the AntennaPod database every 3 days. Only keep the 5 most recent backups.
Importing a database will replace all of your current subscriptions and playing history. You should export your current database as a backup. Do you want to replace?
Access to external storage is required to read the OPML file
Please press OK to restart AntennaPod
This database was exported with a newer version of AntennaPod. Your current installation does not yet know how to handle this file.
Invalid input, time has to be an integer
Automatically activate the sleep timer when pressing play
Automatically activate the sleep timer when pressing play between %1$s and %2$s
You can choose from multiple providers to synchronize your subscriptions and episode play state with
Gpodder.net is an open-source podcast synchronization service that you can install on your own server. Gpodder.net is independent of the AntennaPod project.
Gpoddersync is an open-source Nextcloud app that you can easily install on your own server. The app is independent of the AntennaPod project.
You can pick your own server to synchronize with. When you have identified your preferred synchronization server, please enter its address here.
Grant access using the opened web browser and come back to AntennaPod.
Please provide the credentials of your account on the synchronization server.
Password and data are not encrypted!
Please select the device that you created on the synchronization server or create a new one.
Congratulations! Your gpodder.net account is now linked with your device. AntennaPod will from now on automatically sync subscriptions on your device with your gpodder.net account.
Change the login information for your gpodder.net account.
Synchronize subscription and episode state changes
Re-synchronize all subscriptions and episode states
Logged in as %1$s on %2$s.\n\nYou can choose your synchronization provider again once you have logged out.
Usernames may only contain letters, digits, hyphens and underscores.

Unable to log into your Nextcloud.

- Check your network connection.
- Confirm that you are using the correct server address.
- Make sure that the gpoddersync Nextcloud plugin is installed.
Please choose the base of your data folder. AntennaPod will create the appropriate subdirectories.
Pause playback instead of lowering volume when another app wants to play sounds
Since %1$s, you played %2$s%3$d%4$s hours of podcasts.
Want to join? Whether you want to translate, support, design or code, we would be happy to have you!
AntennaPod is developed by volunteers in their free time. Share your appreciation of their work by leaving a nice rating.
You are not subscribed to this podcast yet. Subscribe for free to access it more easily and keep its playback history.

Auto download is disabled in the main AntennaPod settings

Changing the RSS address can easily break the playback state and episode listings of the podcast. We do NOT recommend changing it and will NOT provide support if anything goes wrong. This cannot be undone. The broken subscription CANNOT be repaired by simply changing the address back. We recommend creating a backup before continuing.
In case of permission denials, you can use this to re-connect to the exact same folder. Do not select another folder.
This virtual podcast was created by adding a folder to AntennaPod.
Unable to start system file manager
Host is not a valid IP address or domain
Shown if your action is required, for example if you need to enter a password.
Allows to control playback. This is the main notification you see while playing a podcast.
Shown when download or feed update fails.
Shown when a new episode of a podcast was found, where notifications are enabled

Looks like you download a lot. Do you want episode lists to show download buttons?

plurals.item: hours waiting in your queue\nfrom %1$d episode
hours waiting in your queue\nfrom %1$d episodes

resources.string: That\'s about %1$s each day until %2$d starts.
That\'s about %1$s each day until %2$d starts. You can start the year clean if you skip a few episodes.
That\'s about %1$s each day until %2$d starts. Wait, what?
We\'ve run some analysis on when episodes are released, and when you completed them. Our conclusion?
Typically, you completed an episode %1$s after it was released.
We\'ve also been wondering: do you listen to the podcasts that you\'re subscribed to?
Looking at the numbers, we think you\'re a hoarder
Numbers don\'t lie, they say. And with only %1$d%% of your %2$d active subscriptions having been played this year, we\'re probably right.
You\'ve played episodes from %1$d%% of your %2$d active subscriptions this year. How about checking out \"%3$s\" again?
You\'ve played episodes from %1$d%% of your %2$d active subscriptions this year. We bet you keep your desk clean, too!
for sticking with us this year!\n\nYou played your first episode with us in %1$s. It\'s been our honor to serve you since.
for joining us this year!\n\nWhether you\'ve moved over from another app, or started your podcast adventure with us: we\'re glad to have you!
Now, let\'s take a look at your favorite podcasts…
